fr.sii.ogham.sms.sender.impl.cloudhopper.preparator

Interface DataCodingProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CharsetMapToCharacterEncodingGroupDataCodingProvider, CharsetMapToGeneralGroupDataCodingProvider, FirstSupportingDataCodingProvider, FixedByteValueDataCodingProvider, SmsGlobalDataCodingProvider

    public interface DataCodingProvider
    Data Coding Scheme is a one-octet field in Short Messages (SM) and Cell Broadcast Messages (CB) which carries a basic information how the recipient handset should process the received message. The information includes:
    • the character set or message coding which determines the encoding of the message user data
    • the message class which determines to which component of the Mobile Station (MS) or User Equipment (UE) should be the message delivered
    • the request to automatically delete the message after reading
    • the state of flags indicating presence of unread voicemail, fax, e-mail or other messages
    • the indication that the message content is compressed
    • the language of the cell broadcast message
    The field is described in 3GPP 23.040 and 3GPP 23.038 under the name TP-DCS. The message is encoded using an Encoder which converts a string to a byte array with a particular charset (see Charset). DataCodingProvider indicates which DataCoding should be used for SMPP message for this particular charset.
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      com.cloudhopper.commons.gsm.DataCoding provide(Encoded encoded)
      Indicates the Data Coding Scheme to use for the specified charset.

    • Method Detail

      • provide

        com.cloudhopper.commons.gsm.DataCoding provide(Encoded encoded)
                                        throws DataCodingException
        Indicates the Data Coding Scheme to use for the specified charset.

        Data Coding Scheme is a one-octet field in Short Messages (SM) and Cell Broadcast Messages (CB) which carries a basic information how the recipient handset should process the received message. The information includes:

        • the character set or message coding which determines the encoding of the message user data
        • the message class which determines to which component of the Mobile Station (MS) or User Equipment (UE) should be the message delivered
        • the request to automatically delete the message after reading
        • the state of flags indicating presence of unread voicemail, fax, e-mail or other messages
        • the indication that the message content is compressed
        • the language of the cell broadcast message
        The field is described in 3GPP 23.040 and 3GPP 23.038 under the name TP-DCS.
        Parameters:
        encoded - The encoded message with the associated charset used to encode the message
        Returns:
        The Data Coding Scheme value. It may be a partial value that can be merged with another. It may also be null
        Throws:
        DataCodingException - when DataCoding couldn't be determined
